Description: Small thick circular ivory (?) disk with hole in centre (does not go through disk, only halfway) and rosette design on top; brown. Base flat, sides smooth.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Bone disk with rosette from fibula, ear-ring, button, pinhead or counter. c. 6th century parallels from Perachora (Payne 1962, 437-39, pl. 186, nos. A222, A230). Payne, H. 1940, Perachora II. The Sanctuaries of Hera Akraia and Limenia: Pottery, ivories, scarabs, and other objects from the votive deposit of Hera Limenia, Oxford.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (WB.10) (Phase 3)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Museum of Fine Arts, Boston
